content.question: The curve consists of three congruent loops that meet at the origin. The first loop is symmetric over the positive x axis. It runs from the origin, up to the right, then down to the right to (r comma theta) equals (3 comma 0). The loop continues down to the left, then up to the left back to the origin. The second loop is identical to the first loop but is a rotation of the first loop about the origin by 2 pi over 3 radians. The second loop is symmetric over theta equals 2 pi over 3 and includes the origin and (r comma theta) equals (3 comma 2 pi over 3). The third loop is identical to the first and second loops but is a rotation of the first loop about the origin by 4 pi over 3 radians.
